title-group.article-title: What Are the Implications of the Institute of Medicine Report “The Future of Nursing: Leading Change, Advancing Health” for School Nursing Practice?

contrib.aff: Director of School Health Services, Massachusetts Department of Public Health, Boston, MA

abstract.p: In 2010, the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation Initiative at the Institute of Medicine issued a comprehensive report entitled, “The Future of Nursing: Leading Change, Advancing Health.” The following is a synopsis of the report, including excerpts, recommendations, and a discussion of school nursing implications.

ack.p: The author would like to thank the National Association of State School Nurse Consultants for their support in writing this article.

bio.p: Anne has been the director of School Health Services for the Massachusetts Department of Public Health since 1990. Collaborating with the Massachusetts School Nurse Organization and the Massachusetts Department of Public Health, she has been responsible for setting standards, developing regulations, overseeing continuing education, and monitoring the Essential School Health Service grants in Massachusetts.

ref.citation: Institute of Medicine. (2010). The future of nursing: Leading change, advancing health. New York: National Academy of Sciences.
